title.narrative: 1.1. STRENGTHENING PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2021, the capacity of the State and society to legislate, manage, allocate budget resources and carry out social surveillance of the following will be improved:(a) preventing and responding to violence and (b) access of children and adolescents to justice., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children and adolescents will be brought up and educated without violence and will access services that guarantee their protection and access to justice

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the capacity of the State and society to legislate, manage, allocate budget resources and carry out social surveillance ofthe following will be improved:(a) preventing and responding to violence; and (b) access of children and adolescents to justice.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s technical assistance;resulted in;the development of operational;budgeting;models,;and;a series of operational guidelines and;instruments for family based alternative care for children,;securing a steady step towards;improved;public;finance;for;child;protection.;UNICEF’s;advocacy effort;resulted;successful for;the Ministry of Justice;to reconsider their;attempt;to reduce the age of criminal responsibility to 14 years old;and UNICEF’s technical expertise supported the development of;integrated;support;component;to go with;newly established;national cash transfer scheme for COVID-19 Orphans.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2021

title.narrative: Number of prioritized results-based budgets that fund violence prevention strategies, improvement of the coverage of services, specialization of operators of protection and justice, and generation of evidence for decision-making.(48392)
Level of progress in the process of adaptation of the legal framework to international standards for children and child victims, authors and witnesses of crime.(48391)

baseline.value: Current legislation only recognizes mandatory public defense for adolescents in conflict with criminal law and juvenile criminal justice legislation does not comply with articles 39 and 40 of the CRC

target.value: 2021:Level 4: Legislation is appropriate with the two prioritized subjects.

title.narrative: An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country

target.value: 2021:Alternative care policy in line with Guidelines implemented

actual.value: 2021:National polity of alternative care in line with international standards and in implementation.

title.narrative: Existence of legal instruments that regulate the functions and competences of the system of protection against violence at national and subnational level.(48390), Text
